intro: Siphocampylus cordatus var. obtusus, commonly known as the bluntleaf siphocampylus, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its foliage has a distinctive, aromatic scent, which is common among plants in its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
